text:
Quick note: the `for loop` link in the documentation here is broken :slightly_smiling_face:
<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup#blog-listing-for-loop|designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup#blog-listing-for-loop>

Hey James,

we have an imported blog (using the same xml structure as the friendly)
<https://airthings-4406702.hs-sites.com/blog/uk-en/top-five-tips-avoid-voc-contamination>.

The import was successful but the featured image settings where still disabled so I think HubSpot isn’t recognising the fact or simply doesn;t support the enabling of the featured image option and placing the link of the attachment in.
Hi, is there a respository with useful HubSpot Code snippets?
Hi Guys, With free HubSpot account , where and how can i practice development?

This will set you on the right path
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
Was there some special fields in wordpress blog that were outside of the norm?
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/projects>
Was just started recently

Hey Ben, I took a look at this and am seeing a lot of duplicates. Some appear to have the correct featured image, some incorrect, and some no featured image at all.
Not sure what the fix would be in your situation, but I would fall back on this being another instance of how the post importer can be pretty fickle.
If you need someone to thoroughly dig into it, the HubSpot support team could help you get this in front of someone who can troubleshoot a little further.
With the GoToWebinar integration, there's no way to have a dropdown menu of upcoming webinars to select within a hubpsot form, is there?
is there a way to edit a global module and make it not global anymore?

tell it to build a wall, and that the rich text field will pay for it.

joking.
click it in your template, then click make local copy
under the more menu

Almost finished first site in HubSpot, 2 final issues left on the single blog page pagination does nothing, on the listing, the load more button links to a sperate page where all posts are listed like single post, they should load in columns like other listings
<http://www.moonoia.com/blog/aiim-report-new-age-of-intelligent-information-management>
<http://www.moonoia.com/blog>
if you are going to have that sidebar for the post, maybe you should create a new template for the listing and set that in the blog settings.

1. I told it to build the biggest bigly waallll. _Didn’t work_
2. I made a local copy and it worked. Thank you good sir
So here's a fun and interesting problem
I've got a page loading a css file from a module that doesnt' exist.
well... the module exists, but the CSS doesn't
busted dat cache, i assume
many many many times... I haven't actually edited the module it's referencing in about a month
Also... that styling applies to a completely different module, so never would have been there to start with
FUN

hmmm… on a side note I think we should all vote on the following:
`1: camelCaseCss` or `2: hyphen-css`
:stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
This project is my last hurrah for camelCase
wellGoodbyeThen lol
i am a kebob-caser.  css is written that way so i should write that way, too

lol I write BEM undercase hyphen css.
never camelcase.

However ironically i write hubl camelcase
I do that as well for BEM, but I’m on the fence when it comes to id’s and camelCase
i know it’s odd but I honestly write BEM style IDs too
Guess I'm actually calling HubSpot support on this one.  brings back memories
Haha. When it comes to IDs, it try to keep my js hat on and leave the css hat off

I’ve just been editing a module all fine and then had a problem with my JS and kept editing it for about 10mins and what ever i did nothing at all changed on the page and i thought i was using the library wrong. Now I realise for some reason the JS hasn’t been updating even when i cachebust :disappointed:

There's definitely something weird going on... I went into the module that said it had CSS but didn't, added some CSS, and about 10 cachebusts later, it got rid of the CSS that wasn't there to start with and added the new stuff...
How long until Friday is over?
i had a similar issue to that last week.  couldnt replicate it to demonstrate, though..
All it took was me trying to show it to my lead dev
I'll try that first with any problems I have in the future, lol
ha!
bring it to the mechanic and it is like it never happened
Are there any plans to allow for html5 validation on single line text fields in HubSpot?
We have a client who wants to do validation on the phone and postal code but i though HS was looking to implement this
thought in HubSpot forms themselves theres a phone field and zip code field.
guessing you’re meaning in custom modules?
there are but i am trying to find the validation they are using as its just a single line text field
for example on phone forcing the ###-###-#### syntax
or something like that
ahh
or in normal single line text fields having it be so validation says it needs to start with `INV-`
things like that
or adding in the `pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}"` param to a single line text for override

Anyone else get notified about the "Improperly Escaped UTF-8 characters" that HubSpot is discontinuing support for on March 4? I'm trying to figure a) what exactly improperly escaped characters are (is it just foreign language characters?), and b) any automated way to find all instances of them around the site. Thanks for any insight!

so even though i can dial in a HubSpot site and get a page load of like 1.5s on pingdom speed test it always gives it a terrible letter score based on technical items… does anybody know if there’s anyway to address the following on HubSpot?
obviously HTTP requests but is there anything else?
What does google’s pagespeed tool say?
I've also been seeing the cacheBuster fail to bust dat cache...
Not that I can tell, hence trying to get a working example of ‘norm’ so I can do a comparison.

fun-fact, you can actually have 2 design manager tabs open for the same file.

The way this can happen is if you click a link to a file in the design manager and you already had the file open before

<https://spin.d.pr/xwkJmT+>
prefix to filename blurred to hide client info
idk if there are any cons to doing this, but if not I might be able to add this as a feature of the chrome extension “duplicate tab”
I don't get the benefit?  I have had two design managers open in browser tabs and mistakenly overwritten what was in the other tab.
this is different
I’m not talking about browser tabs. I’m talking about tabs in the same window. meaning the data may be synced properly
so you would not have the negative of overwriting

okay. so I went to test this. it does sync things properly when you save, but the benefit gets killed after you publish. It keeps both tabs showing in the top bar but one of the tab becomes like a ghost tab, clicking it will open the other tab instead.
guessing they use the id of the file to determine which tab it would go to.
